Title: Manager, People Analytics and Reporting
Description:
Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

Department Summary:

Manager, People Analytics and Reporting

Purpose of Job

The Manager, People Analytics and Reporting is a member of the Total Rewards Leadership Team, responsible for providing strategic leadership and management of the People Analytics and Reporting Team. The People Analytics and Reporting team primarily focuses on creating sustainable enterprise reporting suites and services, supporting business intelligence and work force analytics, while delivering insights and trends to internal stakeholders. This job focuses primarily on cultivating people data from the Workday HR system and processes, benchmarking industry data and building capabilities for the leadership team to make strategic decisions. More specifically, this role focuses on storytelling through analytics, creating dashboards and visualizations, creating reports, and presenting findings to leaders. Creation and tracking of leading-edge people analytics and how they correlate to business outcomes, while leading a team on developing best practices and capabilities in this area is of critical importance. The Manager, People Analytics and Reporting will report to the Director of Total Rewards, HR Technology and Employee Services.

Essential Job Functions

The primary responsibilities of the Manager, People Analytics and Reporting:

Converts datasets into insights that support the design, delivery, and measure the impact of HR and overall people strategy.Proactively identifies trends, relationships and opportunities that help HR develop targeted intervention strategies.Gathers qualitative and quantitative data from a multitude of internal sources to inform insights, results, and the employee experience.Understands and builds metrics aligned to business outcomes related to delivery, utilization, and workforce planning.Tracks, analyzes, and reports people/demographic key performance metrics and related data to evaluate progress towards the goals and effectiveness of HR programs and initiatives. Builds short, medium, and long-term service delivery model for the People Analytics and Reporting TeamServe as business partner and consultant to Human Resources during annual goal setting and in the development of mechanisms to track KPIs for people programs and initiatives.Provide analytical answers to strategic questions about talent processes and stages within the employee lifecycle that influence hiring and retention goals.Interprets data and effectively communicates relevant and meaningful findings to stakeholders and leaders including the development of presentations, briefings, and white papers that use data to show and tell the HR story.Capability to build analytics within Workday and/or other databases to provide analytics and insights beyond reporting.Leading, coaching, managing, and developing the People Analytics and Reporting team.

Required Education, Experience, Knowledge, And Skills

Requires a minimum of 10 years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree; or 8 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 5 years’ experience; or equivalent combination of related education and work experience, with at least one year of experience managing a team.Prior experience setting up an HR Analytics function or leading and managing an existing function.A minimum of two years directly managing people and/or teams. In-depth knowledge of Workday reporting tools, including custom report creation, calculated fields, and report optimization.Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst with deep analytical skills and the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant data set with accuracy.Adept at queries, report writing, scripts, and presenting findings in a way that’s both visually appealing and comprehendible to non-technical staff.Ability to thrive in an ambiguous, dynamic, fast-paced environment.Ability to develop and present reports for all levels of management and key stakeholders that are clear, convincing, informative, engaging, unambiguous, and uniquely tailored to suit different audiences.Experienced in consulting with internal stakeholders to identify and define and evaluate opportunities to determine the best solution.Flexible and proactive problem solver with the ability to collaborate across departments and team with centers of excellence.Demonstrated success in a dynamic, frequently changing, and fast paced environment.Models' managerial courage and consistency to share hard observations and influence leaders “to do the right thing.”

Preferred Skills

At least three years utilizing HR data to support Workforce Analytics or People Analytics teams.Prior experience utilizing a suite of HR analytical tools to support actionable insights, insights for people managers, comprehensive data integration, workforce analytics, engagement, using Tableau, PowerBI, Crunchr, Qualtrics, Visier, CharHop, Sisense, or comparable tools. Prior experience setting up dynamic reporting to distribute reports to various internal customers.

Title: Lead Decision Scientist - Data and Analytics
Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category

Job Details

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Trust is our #1 value at Salesforce. The Data and Analytics (DnA) team powers that value and propels Salesforce growth by providing trusted data, insights, and artificial intelligence that enables us to make more informed decisions in every dimension. We develop tools for financial forecasting, assessing customer health, uncovering adoption insights, data curation, and more, all designed to support another core value at Salesforce... customer success.

The DnA Team Is Organized Into Four Pillars

The T&P (Technology and Product) Pillar of the DnA team serves as analytical partners and trusted advisors to General Managers of Salesforce business lines, as well as to product managers and their maker teams. We empower GMs to grow adoption, retention, and ACV. We empower makers to build easy-to-use and performant products that unlock valueThe Success Pillar exists to drive outcomes for our customers and Salesforce, using the collective mind of DnA to create delightful digital experiences that dazzle stakeholders, boost productivity, and foster a culture of continuous learning and growthThe Sales Pillar helps Sellers and Sales Leaders see the future by providing a predictable view of the business. We develop a scalable, data-driven way to plan our seller capacity, sales territories, and long-range plan. Our team will directly increase AE productivity, increase our margin, and build a foundation for a strong SalesforceThe Transformation Pillar exists to measure, inform, and therefore manage change across the enterprise for initiatives such as margin

We are hiring Decision Scientists across all four Pillars. As a Decision Scientist, you will deliver key insights and analyses that help Salesforce leaders and teams make key decisions that shape strategy, operations, the way we develop products, the way we sell, the way we interact with customers, and much more. You will acquire deep knowledge and understanding of Salesforce products and business goals, build and manage cross-functional relationships, and communicate through digestible, relevant, and actionable storytelling. You will manage data and insights as a product, partnering with data product managers, data engineers, data scientists, ML engineers, visualization engineers, and many other DnA teammates to deliver data products, such as dashboards, ML apps, automation, and much more. You will use business thinking, engineering skills, statistical techniques, and data science practices - such as experimentation, forecasting, clustering, etc. - to wrangle data and deliver relevant and trustworthy insights.

Learn More About Our Culture

Our Story & Core Values: Bringing People together changes everything

Women Leadership: How Salesforce is nurturing women tech leaders of the future

Everyone can be a Trailblazer with Salesforce

Why Bring Your Kids to Work Day is so much more than one day of fun

Success in the Role: What would it look like? 

As a Decision Scientist, you are

A hands-on analystYou will generate insights (e.g., performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioral personas and much more) to accelerate business growth. This requires acquiring and cleaning data from multiple sources, structuring and building data models, analyzing to generate insights, and distributing those insights to business leaders.You have an experimentation mindset. You are excited about understanding the business problem and your internal users, focusing on outcome not output, and iterating to achieve the business outcome through an experimental approach.A strategic problem solver You understand the “big picture” context of your business and analyze data with business a mentality You translate business challenges into an analytical plan; you think practically and creatively to craft quick, effective solutions to problemsA relationship builderYou will develop relationships and collaborate with teams to understand business problems and create and implement an analytical plan You are comfortable delivering insights to an executive audienceA cross-functional partnerYou will partner with data engineers and product managers to instrument, acquire, develop, and structure data assets that are critical to measuring the success of our productsIdentify internal and external collaborators to curate data assets and produce actionable data insights and productsA data champion/A data-lover at heart/data evangelistYou will support the expansion of Salesforce data culture by growing new relationships, hosting learning sessions, integrating or designing new tools, and improving team processes
Your Experiences

5+ years of experience in data analytics or data science or a master’s degree in data science, statistics, applied mathematics, analytics or a related field, or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical equivalent experienceYou are proficient in common analytical programming languages (e.g. Python or R) and SQLYou have a strong understanding of statistical and machine learning methods such as A/B testing, experiment design, causal inference, quasi-experimental methods, common ML models, recommendation systems etc. You are familiar with end-to-end data development, including data model design, quality review, deployment, and maintenanceYou are proficient in telling data stories in a wide range of formats, including slides, charts, and dashboards (e.g. Tableau), and can coherently articulate the business impact of your insights productYou are able to plan projects in detail, set schedules, coordinate resources across product, data, and engineering teams, complete projects end-to-end, and make sure timelines and quality expectations are met

The Senior Director, Data Analytics will be a key strategic leader in the International Operations organization and sits within International Leverage, utilizing advanced analytics to inform and drive operations. The company

A day in the life

Our briefs are always different and that makes the work interesting and exciting. But you can expect the role to involve a mix of the following:

  • Leading research, discovery, and insight development processes that drive decisions around creative, messaging, and campaign design.

  • Conducting or supporting the team with primary research (interviews, surveys, focus groups, creative testing) as well as secondary (desk research, landscape and trend analysis, using audience intelligence tools, social listening).
  • Translating the findings into insights that are both inspiring and actionable, including a core strategic proposition, audience definition and prioritization, and clearly articulated objectives and KPIs.
  • Overseeing or delivering traditional business and marketing frameworks like SWOTs, personas, user journeys, gap analyses, landscape research, creative briefs, etc.
  • Identifying trends and opportunities to innovate our research methodologies to meet emerging needs, experimenting with new approaches or tools to push our insights practice forward, and training other team members.
  • Facilitating and participating in brainstorming sessions, client presentations, workshops and overall project delivery.
  • Growing and manage client portfolio through regular account planning activities, and creating client roadmaps over months and years where appropriate.
  • Crafting and pitching new business as well as representing Blue State via event participation and other thought leadership.
  • Mentoring and upskilling team members.

The team

Good strategy is about taking the best possible journey to your ultimate destination and our Strategy Team is focused on plotting that course for our clients. As a part of the Strategy team, you’ll work closely with a cross-disciplinary group of Blue State employees who are passionate, geeky, and care about their clients and causes. We are a group of strategists that come from a wide range of backgrounds that collaborate to learn from the different approaches and contexts that can make our work better.

We love to understand what makes people tick, what the events of the day impact how people feel, and ultimately, what’s the perfect insight that would mobilize someone to take an action that moves us toward progress. You’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the most inspiring charities, ambitious brands, and passionate advocacy and social change campaigns.

What we offer

  • Unlimited time-off (inclusive of sick, personal, and vacation days)
  • $1,000 annually in professional development funds
  • Competitive health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Inclusive family planning coverage, including fertility, surrogacy, and adoption benefits
  • Flexible and health savings accounts
  • 401K & employer match
  • Generous paid holiday schedule
  • 12-week fully-paid parental leave for all parents-to-be
  • Short-term and long-term disability insurance
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits
  • Remote work flexibility

We approach in-office working with a hybrid model. On-site presence is welcome for US staff who are within commuting distance of the NY or DC office. Managers retain discretion to require in-person attendance for folks on their discipline or client teams as necessary, including for those whose roles require them to be in person. To enter our US offices or attend Blue State events, staff and visitors must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, including with a booster shot when eligible. Exceptions for protected grounds will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

The salary range for this position is $112,500-$140,000; compensation will be commensurate with experience.

Some things we're looking for

  • You have 8+ years of relevant experience in a relevant role.
  • You are not a lone wolf. You genuinely enjoy bringing others along in the process of the work.
  • You have strong communication skills – able to explain your work clearly both in person, in writing and through compelling presentations. You have the ability to build trust and confidence in your work.
  • You have a mix of qualitative and quantitative research experience, using both primary and secondary methods. Bonus if you have familiarity with social psychology, cognitive science and/or behavioral economics frameworks and principles.
  • You have experience utilizing social listening tools like Brandwatch and Audiense, and syndicated survey tools like GWI.
  • You’re a thinker and a doer. You’re happy to roll your sleeves and spend time conducting interviews, focus groups or using audience intelligence tools, as well as championing the findings and building strategic recommendations around them.
  • You have a curious and proactive mind. You like to use substantiated data to both identify and solve problems, with an eye for spotting new opportunities for how research and strategy can make projects stronger. You enjoy designing the right research methodology, be it via audience surveys, focus groups, social listening or desk research, while also switching seamlessly to writing an insightful creative brief.

Title: Senior Principal, Data Insights
Description:
Meet The Company

We are MERU. A values-driven, impact-oriented team dedicated to fixing companies. We provide advisory services and data analytics support to middle-market companies ($50M - $2B in annual sales), and our clients include private equity firms, credit funds, investment banks, and law firms. We bring deep turnaround experience, a group of veteran operators, and an incentive-aligned approach to any situation. MERU was founded by professionals from Alvarez & Marsal and McKinsey and has seen rapid growth in the five-plus years since its founding.

The MERU Way & Valuing Our Team

We're Partners, not consultants. When you join MERU, you will help our clients solve their most pressing problems, supported by a team of people who will challenge you, support you, and inspire you.

In order to be Partners, we don't silo people into just one functional area of the business, instead advancing our team's capabilities by providing training for every service that MERU offers. Additionally, we don't just focus on technical skills but also leadership style and soft skills, so MERU team members not only know what it means to manage a client engagement but to lead a team to success. In training team members to be well-rounded individuals, we can deliver an overall higher impact to clients, allowing the ability to gain experience in diligence, turnarounds, interim management, data science, and more.

To aid this career advancement and development, MERU provides an internal Coach to each team member in order to guide and maintain their professional development plan goals. Unlike most Firms, we actually focus on the achievement of those goals for each individual team member, providing opportunities that would not usually be offered.

Finally, MERU values personal time, only traveling when necessary in order to celebrate and respect your personal life. We believe that by encouraging and mandating balance, it will lead to happier and longer-tenured team members.

When you come to MERU, you come to further your career and maintain your entrepreneurial spirit, never losing sight of the desire to provide meaningful impact, solutions, and value to clients. Learn more about our colleagues’ core characteristics and culture here: https://wearemeru.com/meru-way/

MERU Data Insights Team works with companies at all stages of their digital transformation journey to automate reporting processes, build scalable data platforms, and leverage predictive analytics to transform data from a liability into an asset. Services include Data Discovery and Analysis, Data Prep and Integration, Self-Service Analytics, Data Visualization and Reporting, Data Science and Advanced Analytics, and Strategy Enablement.

Senior Principal Responsibilities

Engage with company executives and private equity stakeholders, acting as the data analytics subject matter expert through customer-centric solution development and value-driven delivery.Lead delivery teams consisting of Analytics Engineers and Solutions Architects to implement full modern stack platforms, including collecting business requirements, building data warehouse/data lakes, developing intuitive visualizations and reports, and end-user training.Demonstrated capability to oversee multiple workstreams, helping to establish priorities, drive timely completion of deliverables, and lead problem-solving sessions.Produce high-quality, client facing, production-level code and sustainable architectural designs, all while setting best practice standards for junior team members.Serve as a leader in the MERU Data Insights practice, driving knowledge management, collaboration, and providing mentorship to team members.Lead proposal development (i.e., assistance with analysis/presentation, etc.) and proactively identify ways to improve the proposal quality (i.e., research, package case studies, etc.).

Senior Principal Qualifications

7+ years of business intelligence or data analytics experience.4+ years of capability leadership or delivery management in a data analytics consulting or client-facing role is required.Bachelor’s degree from a top university.Master’s degree related to analytics or information system is preferred.Expert knowledge and delivery experience with Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or any other data visualization tools.Strong knowledge and experience with ETL tools like Power Query, Azure Data Factory, Fivetran, Stitch, Alteryx, and languages like SQL, Python, or R.Knowledge or experience working with cloud data warehouses (Azure, Snowflake, GCP, AWS).Relevant certifications associated with business intelligence tools.Experience in leading cross-functional teams to deliver high quality data products.Experience in helping build out data teams, data functions, or data services from the ground up highly preferred.Demonstrated ability to interact and work collaboratively with junior and senior team members, senior management, and other stakeholders or professionals.“Roll up your sleeves” mentality and willingness to complete any task if needed, no matter the role.Experience in project management and independently managing deliverables.Effective communication skills to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience or senior executives.Ability to assist with internal firm initiatives (e.g., marketing, client pitches).Willingness to travel up to 20%.Ability to work full time in an office and remote environment; physically able to sit/stand at a computer and work in front of a computer screen for significant portions of the workday.Authorization to work in the United States.Commitment to living MERU’s values and core characteristics.

$200,000 - $230,000 a year

In addition to benefits, MERU also offers an extremely competitive bonus program that is based on firm contribution efforts and performance.

Performance Improvement

Overview of MERU Service Offerings:

Help companies identify and achieve their full potential by leveraging a value-focused approach to driving sustainable margin expansion impact. Services include MERU 360° Assessment, Transformation Plan Development, Chief Transformation Officer placement, Cash Cycle and Working Capital Optimization, and Implementation Performance Management.

Turnaround & Restructuring

Partner with clients during uncertain times to help stabilize operations and rapidly triage the causes of financial distress, charting a path back to long-term sustainability. Services include Interim Management, Turnaround Plan Development and Execution, Liquidity Management, Stakeholder Negotiations, Strategic Alternatives Assessment, Bankruptcy, Insolvency, and Case Management.

Transaction Services

Partner with private equity firms across the investment lifecycle, from due diligence to portfolio value creation and exit planning. Services include Due Diligence, Pre-Close Planning, Post-Close Implementation, and Exit Planning.

Data Insights

Work with companies at all stages of their digital transformation journey to automate reporting processes, build scalable data platforms, and leverage predictive analytics to transform data from a liability into an asset. Services include Data Discovery and Analysis, Data Prep and Integration, Self-Service Analytics, Data Visualization and Reporting, Data Science and Advanced Analytics, and Strategy Enablement.

Voluntary Inclusion

Unsolicited Resumes From Third-Party Recruiters

Please note that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters are engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any employment agency, person, or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that MERU will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person, or entity.

Title: People Analytics Lead
Description:
We are looking for an experienced People Analytics Lead to help build a stellar data and insights function supporting our dynamic workforce. You'll craft our people analytics strategy from the ground up, serving as an expert advisor to leadership on all things talent data. The ideal candidate thrives on diving deep into complex workforce questions, proposing and measuring people programs, and translating insights into strategic recommendations to optimize how we attract, engage, develop and retain our innovative teams.

About Anthropic

Anthropic is an AI safety and research company that’s working to build reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems. We want AI to be safe and beneficial for our customers and for society as a whole. Our interdisciplinary team has experience across ML, physics, policy, business and product.

Responsibilities:

Build our people analytics program, developing interactive dashboards, automated reporting and visualizations to track key HR and workforce metrics for department leadersCollect, analyze, and interpret HR, talent, and workforce data to uncover insights and trends related to headcount, diversity & inclusion, employee lifecycle, performance management, engagement, retention, etc. Identify opportunities for process improvements through data analysis, making recommendations to optimize talent acquisition, development, retention, employee experience, and workforce planningClearly communicate key takeaways from people analytics reports to inform leadership's strategic decision-making around talentTrain HR colleagues, people managers, and employees on how to leverage HR data and analytics to optimize talent practicesStay current on latest trends in HR analytics, workforce planning, and people analytics technology to ensure our organization stays at the forefront

You may be a good fit if you:

5+ years experience in talent acquisition or HR focused on reporting, analytics or dataExpert skills in data tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, Looker, etc.) and experience working with HR systems such as Workday Proficiency extracting and manipulating large, complex datasetsStrong critical thinking, analytical and problem solving abilitiesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsA sense of humor, a preference for fast-paced work, and a bias towards action

Strong candidates may also:

Have built a people analytics function from the ground up, identifying what’s most important and performing multivariate and statistical analysis on people dataHave a growth mindset with a passion for AI's potential to positively impact the world and realistic assessment of its risks and limitations

Annual Salary (USD)

The expected salary range for this position is $220k - $275k

Logistics

Location-based hybrid policy: Currently, we expect all staff to be in our office at least 25% of the time.

Deadline to apply: None. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

US visa sponsorship: We do sponsor visas! However, we aren't able to successfully sponsor visas for every role and every candidate; operations roles are especially difficult to support. But if we make you an offer, we will make every effort to get you into the United States, and we retain an immigration lawyer to help with this.

We encourage you to apply even if you do not believe you meet every single qualification. Not all strong candidates will meet every single qualification as listed. Research shows that people who identify as being from underrepresented groups are more prone to experiencing imposter syndrome and doubting the strength of their candidacy, so we urge you not to exclude yourself prematurely and to submit an application if you're interested in this work. We think AI systems like the ones we're building have enormous social and ethical implications. We think this makes representation even more important, and we strive to include a range of diverse perspectives on our team.

Compensation and Benefits*

Anthropic’s compensation package consists of three elements: salary, equity, and benefits. We are committed to pay fairness and aim for these three elements collectively to be highly competitive with market rates.

Equity - On top of this position's salary (listed above), equity will be a major component of the total compensation. We aim to offer higher-than-average equity compensation for a company of our size, and communicate equity amounts at the time of offer issuance.

US Benefits - The following benefits are for our US-based employees:

 Optional equity donation matching at a 3:1 ratio, up to 50% of your equity grant.  Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance for you and all your dependents.  401(k) plan with 4% matching.  22 weeks of paid parental leave.  Unlimited PTO – most staff take between 4-6 weeks each year, sometimes more! Stipends for education, home office improvements, commuting, and wellness.  Fertility benefits via Carrot.  Daily lunches and snacks in our office.  Relocation support for those moving to the Bay Area. 

UK Benefits - The following benefits are for our UK-based employees:

 Optional equity donation matching at a 3:1 ratio, up to 50% of your equity grant.  Private health, dental, and vision insurance for you and your dependents.  Pension contribution (matching 4% of your salary).  22 weeks of paid parental leave.  Unlimited PTO – most staff take between 4-6 weeks each year, sometimes more! Health cash plan.  Life insurance and income protection.  Daily lunches and snacks in our office.  This compensation and benefits information is based on Anthropic’s good faith estimate for this position as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future. Employees based outside of the UK or US will receive a different benefits package. The level of pay within the range will depend on a variety of job-related factors, including where you place on our internal performance ladders, which is based on factors including past work experience, relevant education, and performance on our interviews or in a work trial. 

How We're Different

We believe that the highest-impact AI research will be big science. At Anthropic we work as a single cohesive team on just a few large-scale research efforts. And we value impact — advancing our long-term goals of steerable, trustworthy AI — rather than work on smaller and more specific puzzles. We view AI research as an empirical science, which has as much in common with physics and biology as with traditional efforts in computer science. We're an extremely collaborative group, and we host frequent research discussions to ensure that we are pursuing the highest-impact work at any given time. As such, we greatly value communication skills. We do not have boundaries between engineering and research, and we expect all of our technical staff to contribute to both as needed.

The easiest way to understand our research directions is to read our recent research . This research continues many of the directions our team worked on prior to Anthropic, including: GPT-3 , Circuit-Based Interpretability , Multimodal Neurons , Scaling Laws , AI & Compute , Concrete Problems in AI Safety , and Learning from Human Preferences .

Come work with us!

Anthropic is a public benefit corporation based in San Francisco. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, optional equity donation matching, generous vacation and parental leave, flexible working hours, and a lovely office space in which to collaborate with colleagues.

Title: Manager, People Analytics
Description:
The Role: 

The Manager, People Analytics will play a critical role in guiding Morningstar’s human capital data capabilities, analyzing this data, and harvesting and sharing insights that support decisions related to our employee experience, workforce, and talent strategies. The role is responsible for the people analytics data functions, and for coordinating with HR and business leaders to inspire change through actionable insights. The role reports to the Head ofStrategy, and Analytics within Morningstar’s People & Culture (HR) function and will work closely with technical/systems experts in Workday, Tableau, PowerBI, and Qualtrics to maintain and advance data/analytics capabilities within an articulated people analytics strategy you’ll help to develop.

The ideal candidate will have experience within a mature people analytics function and can draw on this experience in charting the path for advancing Morningstar’s capability. You will be a strong collaborator with a natural ability to get to the heart of core questions/problems, design research/analytics programs around those problems, execute research plans, develop insights based on the research outputs, and then communicate insights in a manner that is appropriate and actionable for the relevant decision-making audience. Depending on the nature of the analysis/insight, your stakeholders may include employees, managers, HR leadership, Finance leaders, and executive leadership.

This role is based in our Chicago, Toronto or Madrid office. We are operating in a hybrid environment (3 days/in office).

What You’ll Do:

Demonstrate thought leadership on current research approaches and innovative solutions for assessing and measuring the employee experience and talent lifecycle from pre-hire to exit. Partner with HR leadership to design and deliver insights that will inform strategy and help execute on workforce/talent initiatives. Collaborate with other cross-functional teams to identify key business/human capital questions and develop analytics solutions to address them. Support the design and execution of a holistic employee listening strategy, including design and administration of pulse, lifecycle, and ad hoc surveys, and integration of insights across the talent lifecycle. Conduct research and make recommendations on trends, benchmarks, and standard processes to drive the company's long-term talent strategy and effectiveness. Drive continuous improvement by evaluating existing analytics processes and recommending enhancements or new methodologies. Analyze workforce and talent data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in areas such as recruitment, retention, performance, and diversity & inclusion. Interpret complex data sets and communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders in a clear, concise, and compelling manner. Partner with HRBPs, business leaders, and other stakeholders to deliver quarterly engagement survey and organizational health insights, analysis, Translate metric priorities into designs/ideas for new dashboards and key reports with compelling visualizations and storytelling to help guide decision-making regarding talent and organizational practices Extract HR, finance, and business data from enterprise technology platforms, and format/wrangle data for analysis and visualization Develop metrics and KPIs to monitor the efficiency, effectiveness, and impact of HR programs Design and develop interactive reports and dashboards to distill large volumes of data into a user-friendly presentation of key insights 


What We’re Looking For:

7+ years business experience, with 3-5 years in a data/people analytics function Demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience in data analysis, data modeling, statistical analysis, quantitative and qualitative research methods, forecasts, and predictions. Proven knowledge of, and experience with, end-to-end talent lifecycle measurement and employee experience listening programs. Ability to integrate, analyze, and effectively communicate insights to all levels of the organization, making complex information accessible and compelling through well-organized storyboards, graphics and visual outputs. Experience navigating a global company where cultures, time zones, priorities, and language create interesting challenges for advancing work. Extreme attention to detail and accuracy, with an exceptional results orientation and demonstrated personal initiative and customer centric perspectives. Ability to take a design thinking approach to optimize solutions. Adaptable to work with shifting priorities and comfort operating in an evolving, fast paced environment. Able to work under tight deadlines and plan, organize and carry out multiple, detailed tasks. Working knowledge of HR/analytics systems including Workday, Adaptive Planning, Cornerstone, PowerBI, Qualtrics EX, and AI tools; more intensive knowledge/experience of these systems is a plus. Advanced Excel skills (including functions, macros, and pivot tables) Knowledge of human resources practices, techniques, and standards is a plus Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent work experience. Role can be based in Chicago, NY, London, or Madrid

 Drives the development and management the implementation of the Data product development roadmap based on knowledge of business and data strategy.  Plans and coordinates development of data assets, strategic initiatives, and ensures integration into roadmap based on knowledge of short-and longer-term needs of a single data category.  Drives collaboration with cross-functional teams to gather inputs and requirements. Consultants, educates and influences the data journey across the organization.  Executes product development within a moderate to complex category, ensuring achievement of data product development objectives and identifying and prioritizing tradeoffs across data product development initiatives.  Drives the execution of business plans and projects to meet customers and operational needs; communicating business plans and priorities; reporting on barriers and obstacles that impact performance. 

Job Competencies

 Driving Customer/Client Needs: Researches and verifies customer needs and expectations. Builds and maintains consistent customer connections and solicits customer feedback. Creates customer journeys and identifies customer touchpoints. Addresses gaps/risks in product experiences. Simplifies and improves processes to drive customer satisfaction.  Data Vision & Strategy: Owns a customer problem and/or product requirements/needs. Assists in building new ideas/products. Explores new areas for value creation and develops a long-term vision. Articulates problem statements and hypotheses and guides team towards prototypes. Effectively communicates product strategy and vision.  Product Roadmap & Development: Builds a product roadmap with proper phasing. Communicates with cross functional partners and stakeholders. Builds stakeholder alignment. Independently manages backlog/priority tradeoff decisions and communications. Manages product/feature rollouts and scaling and iteratively optimizes the product.  Data Driven Strategy Decisions: Independently conducts activities for product/feature analytics. Monitors, collects, and structures data and evaluates results. Assist in the planning, design, and implementation of exploratory data analysis.  Influencing & Building Stakeholder Consensus: Communicates in stakeholder meetings involving multiple teams. Conveys complex information and addresses ambiguity for robust data asset development. Influences team members and stakeholders with sound recommendations. Independently prepares clear, concise, and logically structured reports/materials. Seeks and provides constructive feedback, anticipates needs/questions, and responds appropriately.  Technology Orientation: Demonstrates a basic understanding of privacy & security policies and process. Owns business and user acceptance for products/features. Independently represents data requirements and drives data design outcomes. Demonstrates an understanding of data architecture, services involved, and database and cloud technologies used. Drives informed discussions with engineering teams and stakeholders to assess feasibility and risks and prioritize efforts, features and capabilities.  Domain Expertise: Identifies areas of innovation across the Data Analysis, Data Visualization, Business Intelligence and Reporting, shares innovations with the leadership team and drives initiatives. Recommends new processes, automation opportunities and ways of working for subdomains. Consultatively influences and recommends new processes, automation opportunities and ways of working. 

You'll sweep us off our feet if...

You're curious, always looking for new opportunities to up our game and are customer obsessedYou're a great communicator, able to articulate your insights and findings to various levels of the organizationYou have a deep interest and passion helping teams consultatively and with agility identify, map, and deliver transformative value adding data solutions.You are creative and resilient - always looking for new ways to enable teams to improve and deliver value continuously.You have strong problem solving, analytic, decision-making, and excellent communication with interpersonal skills. You are self-driven and motivated with the desire to work in a fast-paced, results-driven agile environment with varied responsibilities.You have knowledge and working experience in cloud and data technologies: GIT, SQL, Spark, Druid, Hive, Hadoop, Teradata, GCP and BigQueryYou have strong experience and have working experience of technologies for Analytics, AI, Business Intelligence, Visualization, and Reporting E.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, Python, etc.Product Management Certification or Certified Scrum Professional (CSP) is always a plus.

Qualifications

Capable of managing multiple stakeholders, anticipating their needs, and gaining alignment for strategies from executive level stakeholdersStrong communication skills (oral, verbal, and listening) as well as the ability to influence key decision-makers and understand their points of view Strong leadership, negotiation, and execution skills with the ability to drive results, deliver and excel, and own it when you don't Comfortable in a fast-paced, growing environment and work well with ambiguityProven ability to drive results, especially in a matrixed or influence based environmentUnderstands, describes, and navigates existing work and makes recommendations with a clear sense of organizational impactExperience in practicing agile methodologies - Scrum, KanbanProficiency in using tools such as Jira Board, Confluence, Roadmap ToolsTechnical experience in Data Analytics, Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, AI, and Reporting.

experience in data analytics or related field.

Description:
Description

At Audible, we believe stories have the power to transform lives. It’s why we work with some of the world’s leading creators to produce and share audio storytelling with our millions of global listeners. We are dreamers and inventors who come from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences to empower and inspire each other. Imagine your future with us.

About This Role

As an Advanced Analytics Lead at Audible, you will drive the design, implementation, and delivery of Analytics solutions in a highly ambiguous and significantly complex problem space that will have a long-term impact on the business, organization, and technology. You will deliver solutions that address significantly large or endemic customer and business problems, and directly impact the goals of our Analytics, Marketing, Product and/or Content organizations. In addition, you will raise the bar on already well-developed sets of analytic, economic, scientific and financial frameworks that drive decisions across multiple marketing channels and product surfaces. With a “consulting mindset”, you will influence the organization towards adopting new approaches, concepts, and paradigms.

About You

You are a “doer”, someone that can code at a very good level in SQL and Python, and deliver products or prototypes end-to-end (from conception, to design, to specification, to code, to test, to measurement, to presentation). You connect the dots and understand system inter-dependencies and limitations to build efficient solutions. You have an outstanding business acumen that helps you speak fluently in your business partners’s language, and helps them achieve or surpass their goals. You work fast and deliver reliably against your commitments. You can frame hypotheses, decisions, and assumptions into a testable structure and develop robust experimental designs.

As a Advanced Analytics Lead, you will...

 Partner with data scientists, BIEs and business leaders to understand, conceive, design, code, test, measure and present ground breaking Analytics-, Science- and Data-products that bring Audible to the next stage on its way to a thought-leading, world-class Data-Driven business Own some analytics product end-to-end, and contribute to others Possess an in-depth knowledge of all relevant data sources, business intelligence technologies, data science and analytical tools – know what’s possible, in which direction to steer, and how to move fast with solutions, adjustments and recommendations Communicate verbally or in writing to business customers and leadership to share insights and recommendations

About Audible

Audible is the leading producer and provider of audio storytelling. We spark listeners’ imaginations, offering immersive, cinematic experiences full of inspiration and insight to enrich our customers daily lives. Our Hub+Home hybrid workplace model gives employees the flexibility between gathering in a common office space (work from hub) and remote work (work from home). For more information, please visit adbl.co/hybrid.

Newark, NJ, USA

 5+ years of relevant experience in the areas of Strategic Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Science, or Consulting in a digital environment or in a related field Degree in science, economy, technology, mathematics or a related field Demonstrated high achievement in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence Strong experience working in ecommerce analytics, marketing analytics, experimentation/AB testing, membership/loyalty analytics and revenue management techniques Strong experience in spearheading or supporting business initiatives through data-driven decision frameworks, in particular through the conception, execution, and measurement of experimental A/B plans, measurement frameworks, decision making systems, simulation and scenario tools, and data science models Strong hands-on experience in developing data-driven products (ML models, forecasting tools, etc.) with programming languages (Python, R) Strong expertise in scripting languages (such as SQL, VBA, etc.) and the tools (such as MS excel, PowerPoint, etc.) Experience in developing visualization tools and scorecards such as Tableau, Microstrategy, Shiny, etc., and analytics/presentation, and sharing business recommendations and their financial/customer impact with the stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications

 MS degree (Sciences, Operations Research (OR), Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar field), Business (MBA) or equivalent experience Experience in a similar business environment (entertainment industry, subscriptions businesses, digital commerce)

Who We Are

WE ARE PRICELINE.

Our success as one of the biggest players in online travel is all thanks to our incredible, dedicated team of talented employees. Priceline is part of the Booking Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: BKNG) family of companies, a highly profitable global online travel company with a market capitalization of over $80 billion. Our sister companies include Booking.com, BookingGo, Agoda, Kayak and OpenTable.

If you want to be part of something truly special, check us out!

Flexible work at Priceline

Priceline is following a hybrid working model, which includes two days onsite as determined by you and your manager (ideally selecting among Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday). On the remaining days, you can choose to be remote or in the office.

Diversity and Inclusion are a Big Deal!

To be the best travel dealmakers in the world, it’s important we have a workforce that reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We are committed to cultivating a culture where all employees have the freedom to bring their individual perspectives, life experiences, and passion to work.

Priceline is a proud equal opportunity employer. We embrace and celebrate the unique lenses through which our employees see the world. We’d love you to join us and add to our rich mix!

Description:
Hi, we’re Gravie. Our mission is to improve the way people purchase and access healthcare through innovative, consumer-centric health benefit solutions that people can actually use. Our industry-changing products and services are developed and delivered by a diverse group of unique people. We encourage you to be your authentic self - we like you that way.

A Little More About Us

 We know healthcare. Our company was founded and is still led by industry veterans who have started and grown several market-leading companies in the space. We are quickly becoming one of the fastest growing health benefits companies in the country. We have received numerous awards and accolades, including Inc. Magazine Best in Business Gold Medal award in 2021, and JMP Securities Top 50 Private Companies in Insurtech in 2022. We have raised money from top tier investors who share the same long-term vision as we do of building an industry defining company that will endure over the long run. We are well capitalized. Our customers like us. Our revenue churn is in the low single digits, in an industry where greater than 20% churn is common. Our culture is unique. We tend to be non-hierarchical, merit-driven, opinionated but kind people who thrive working in a high-performance, fast-paced environment. People at Gravie care deeply about making a positive impact in the lives of the people we serve. We may not be the right place for everybody, but if you get energized by doing work every day that focuses on putting consumers at the front of the line, we could be a great place for you. It takes unique people and diverse perspectives to deliver our results. We encourage you to be your authentic self – we like you that way.


A Little More About The Role

We’re looking for a Manager of Data Analytics for our Data Strategy and Analytics Team. You’ll take what we’re doing - creating a health plan people will love – and apply data analytics across the company to help us achieve our goals. You will assess what we have today, identify the biggest opportunities for impact, and partner with the Director of Data Strategy and Analytics to build an analytics roadmap to achieve that impact. You’ll lead an innovative team of Data Analysts to design and execute in-depth analyses that provide actionable recommendations to the business.

You Will

 Manage and execute on the strategy for maximizing the value of data analytics at Gravie, including but not limited to request intake, analysis design and execution, quality review, and delivery of actionable insights. Proactively engage with business leaders to understand their business problems and questions, and identify opportunities for data analytics solutions. Partner closely with business leaders to deliver insights that will inform key decisions and improve our products and operations. Lead the creation, review, and delivery of regular and ad hoc statistical analysis across all areas of the business through the leadership of your team and digging in yourself to tackle the most complex problems. Foster strong relationships with stakeholders across the organization, including senior leaders, acting as a trusted advisor on all things data and analytics. Design and measure key metrics to track the value and performance of the data analytics organization and actively address opportunities for improvement. Collaborate with Reporting, Analytics Engineering and Data Engineering to translate ad-hoc analysis into robust and reliable data models and dashboards when relevant. Provide technical leadership to a team of talented data analysts, using your mathematical, statistical and analytics knowledge to mentor and provide technical direction to your team. Leverage your amazing people leadership and talent development skills to ensure the true talent in your team is unleashed. Continually evolve the skillset of the team for advanced analytics methods and techniques, including statistical analysis. Stay informed of and employ innovative analytic techniques and tools to analyze both structured and unstructured data.


Qualifications

 Strong domain knowledge with expertise in Healthcare Analytics and business functions such as Claims, Underwriting, and Actuarial Minimum of 5 years of analytics experience, with 3 years of experience in Healthcare Analytics Experience with health insurance, health plans, clinical programs, care navigation or adjacent industries 3+ years of experience leading a high performing analytics team to meet or exceed ambitious expectations Demonstrated success driving for and delivering results through collaboration Strong analytical aptitude and problem-solving skills Advanced SQL and statistical programming skills (Python, R, etc.) Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as Healthcare Analytics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related discipline; Master's degree preferred Previous experience working with a team in a high growth and fast paced environment History of managing complex processes and multi-layered projects Passion for building impactful health benefit products and delivering amazing customer experiences


Competitive pay is standard. Our unique benefits program is the gravy, i.e., the special sauce that sets our compensation package apart. In addition to standard benefits, Gravie’s package includes alternative medicine coverage, flexible PTO, up to 16 weeks paid parental leave, paid holidays, cell phone reimbursement, education reimbursement, and 1 week of paid paw-ternity leave just to name a few.

Title: Data Scientist and Visualization Specialist
Description:
Job Number: R0180699

Data Scientist and Visualization Specialist

The Opportunity: 

As a seasoned data scientist and visualization specialist, you’re excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set, and you’re fascinated by the possibilities presented by machine learning and artificial intelligence. In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities. At Booz Allen, you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence, we need you to help find the answers in the data.

On our team supporting a DoD client, you’ll use your problem-solving know-how, data science expertise, and data visualization skills to create real-world impact. You’ll work closely with our DoD clients to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn sets of disparate data points into objective answers to advise your clients as they make informed decisions. You’ll develop rich visualizations to convey complex multi-dimensional information. Ultimately, you’ll provide a deep understanding of the data, what it all means, and how it can be used.

Work with us as we use data science for good.
